#Text=AirAsia disaster : Bodies , wreckage found
#Text=Tuesday , December 30 , 2014
#Text=Search and rescue teams today began recovering bodies after debris from Indonesia AirAsia Flight 8501 was spotted in the sea near Borneo .
#Text=The flight from Surabaya to Singapore vanished from radar screens early on Sunday morning over the Java Sea .
#Text=155 passengers and seven crew were on board .
#Text=Most were Indonesians , with three South Koreans , one Malaysian , one Brit and one French person on board .
#Text=An Indonesian naval ship today recovered at least three bodies .
#Text=TvOne broadcast uncensored footage that was seen by distressed relatives at Juanda International Airport , where the plane departed .
#Text=TvOne has apologised and switched to blurred-out footage .
#Text=The crashed aircraft , photographed in April .
#Text=Image : Oka Sudiatmika .
#Text=Yesterday evening searchers stated they were using twelve helicopters , eleven planes , and 32 vessels .
#Text=Australia , Singapore , and Malaysia sent assistance with the search .
#Text=Local fishing boats have also joined .
#Text=The US , UK , and France have been asked for help locating submerged remains .
#Text=USS Sampson , a US Navy destroyer , is due to join search efforts today .
#Text=National Search and Rescue Agency head Bambang Soelistyo says a " shadow " on the seabed , spotted by the air force , is thought to be the wreck site .
#Text=The nearest airstrip is in Pangkalan Bun , Borneo , about 160 km away .

#Text=AirNav , the Indonesian national air traffic control ( ATC ) facility , yesterday said the aircraft was given permission to divert to avoid bad weather ; the area was experiencing thunderstorms .
#Text=That was at 6:12 local time .
#Text=The flight crew next asked to climb from 32,000 ft to 38,000ft .
#Text=Controllers conferred with Singapore and agreed the plane could climb as high as 34,000ft with another flight preventing a higher altitude .
#Text=When they radioed permission at 6:14 they received no answer .
#Text=The flight vanished from radar at 6:17 .
#Text=The transponder ceased to be received a minute later .
#Text=A leaked screenshot from an ATC radar screen shows the flight ascending without permission through 36,000ft with a ground speed of 353 knts .
#Text=The aircraft would normally be travelling faster , with an Emirates jet also on the screen showing a ground speed of 503knts at 36,000ft .
#Text=An insufficient speed can cause an aircraft to stall .
#Text=Indonesian Pilot Iriyanto and French co-pilot Remi Emmanuel Plesel did not explain their request to climb .
#Text=They have over 8,000 hours experience between them .
#Text=They were flying Airbus A320-200 registration PK-AXC and serial number 3648 , which was six years old .
#Text=It last underwent maintenance in November .
#Text=Management company Doric own and lease the aircraft .
#Text=The plane had accumulated 23,000 flying hours on 13,600 flights .
#Text=It went missing around 40 minutes into a flight to Changi International Airport .
#Text=Iriyanto 's previous employers include the Indonesian Air Force , Merpati Airlines , and Adam Air .
#Text=The 53-year-old also has ten years experience as a pilot trainer .
#Text=He has flown for AirAsia for three years .
#Text=Investigations are to be led by the Indonesian National Transportation Safety Committee .
#Text=France-based airframer Airbus , the BEA , which investigates aviation mishaps in France , and the US National Transportation Safety Board have all offered assistance .
#Text=Reuters spoke to an anonymous source within the investigation .
#Text=" Why did [ Iriyanto ] request to climb at that stage ?

column1: #Text=He added Iriyanto " came from the air force , one of their best graduates .
